Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel (joined to EA66336, 66363 and 66370), the interior is slightly grooved and covered with a dark brown resinous deposit, the fabric is grey in section, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of eight lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: Being studied for publication by Bryan Kraemer. Cemeteries and Osireion Excavations Group
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393858) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393858)
